import { Meta } from '@storybook/addon-docs';

<Meta title="Docs/Theme/Blocks" />

# Theme Blocks
A set of components to use in Storybook to display theme. It provides
the following block components:

- Typography Block
- Color Block
- Spacing Block
- Border Block
- Shadow Block
- Palette Block
- Components Block
- Icons Block ( icons not included )

## Example
Here is an example Storybook story that uses the theme Blocks.

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import {
  TypographyBlocks,
  ColorBlocks,
  SpacingBlocks,
  PaletteBlocks,
  BorderBlocks,
  ShadowBlocks,
  ThemeProvider,
  darkTheme,
  IconBlocks,
  useTheme
} from 'reablocks';

import resolveConfig from 'tailwindcss/resolveConfig';
import tailwindConfig from '../path_to_tw_config/tailwind.config';
const { theme: TWConfig } = resolveConfig(tailwindConfig);

export default {
  title: 'General/Theme',
  component: ThemeProvider,
  decorators: [
    Story => (
      <ThemeProvider theme={darkTheme}>
        <div style={{ width: '90vw' }}>
          <Story />
        </div>
      </ThemeProvider>
    )
  ]
};

export const Colors = () => <ColorBlocks colors={TWConfig.colors} />;

const palettes = tailwindConfig.theme.extend.colors;
palettes['disabled'] = [palettes['disabled']];
export const Palettes = () => <PaletteBlocks palettes={palettes as any} />;

export const Typography = () => (
  <TypographyBlocks
    families={TWConfig.fontFamily}
    sizes={TWConfig.fontSize}
    weights={TWConfig.fontWeight}
  />
);

export const Spacings = () => <SpacingBlocks spacings={TWConfig.spacing} />;

export const Borders = () => <BorderBlocks borders={TWConfig.borderRadius} />;

export const Shadows = () => <ShadowBlocks shadows={TWConfig.boxShadow} />;

export const Components = () => {
  const { theme } = useTheme();

  return (
    <ComponentBlocks components={theme.components} />
  )
};
export const Icons = () => (
  <>
    <h2>Icon Block Helper ( icons not included )</h2>
    <IconBlocks
      icons={[
        {
          name: 'favorite',
          src: favoriteIcon
        },
        {
          name: 'another favorite',
          src: favoriteIcon
        }
      ]}
    />
  </>
);

````

NOTE: This example uses the `ThemeProvider` in the story decorator,
but you can also use it in the `preview.js` file to wrap all stories.
